title: Logical Equivalence - Part 1
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: So look at this particular truthtable.
Do you see these two columns?
It's clear that these two columns are exactly the same.
It simply signifies that look at the columns and the corresponding headers of these columns.
The fact that for every possible input that you can think of these two Boolean expressions
By agree I mean if he is zero, he is zero.
That is one, this is one.
Right, which means they both are equivalent.
So this is what we mean by equivalence of two Boolean expressions.
We say they are logically the same.
